> And I notice the sql you provided is insert sql, not create table, so it is maybe the key point of the issue.

I already create table `device_0,device_1`, such as 

```
create table if not exists jooq_example.device_0
(
  id          bigint       not null
    primary key,
  code        varchar(64)  not null,
  name        varchar(64)  not null,
  description varchar(255) null,
  constraint device_code_uindex
    unique (code),
  constraint device_name_uindex
    unique (name)
);
```

Tracking the history issues about boolean value and tinyint in sharding-proxy:

1. https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere/issues/2528
2. https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere/issues/2604
3. https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere/issues/3027 

The history may help us to know why sharding-proxy behaves like this.

OKAY智慧教育 https://www.okayzhihui.com/
OK, I will try.

I guess this issue caused by the insert SQL do not have sharding key, so ShardingSphere process the SQL as boarding cast SQL and write into all tables which you configured.

If you only want route data into one table, please add sharding key into your insert SQL.

We can keep focus on this issue until we make sure it is really cannot reproduce.

I am not saying ShardingSphere do not support, but the first thing is perhaps you need to design your business logic.

> Please fix all code review suggestions.
> 
> And more more question for design, how to enable this SPI? Does need user add to SPI file by themselves?
> Maybe we should consider about spilt this code to a new module and setup SPI fine in the new module.
> If user import this module, they can load from SPI automatically.

@ustbyjy Hi, I try to reproduce the issue, but failed. So, the my reproduce code, let us discuss the exact way to reproduce the issue, and my reproduce code link is: https://github.com/sluk3r/incubator-shardingsphere-example/tree/ss_issue_2920, tag is myCreatedDbRun, the code is based on incubator-shardingsphere-example. 

the sql is "SELECT i.* FROM **T_ORDER** o left join **t_order_item** i on o.order_id = i.order_id", which is in class of OrderItemRepositoryImpl, in package of "org.apache.shardingsphere.example.core.jdbc.repository",  in method of "selectAll"

And when I run the JavaConfigurationExampleMain class, with "sql.show" as true,  I saw the rewrote sql is "SELECT i.* FROM **t_order_0** o left join **t_order_item_0** i on o.order_id = i.order_id", as shown in the log:

```java
[ShardingSphere-SQL] Actual SQL: demo_ds ::: SELECT i.* FROM t_order_0 o left join t_order_item_0 i on o.order_id = i.order_id 
[ShardingSphere-SQL] Actual SQL: demo_ds ::: SELECT i.* FROM t_order_1 o left join t_order_item_1 i on o.order_id = i.order_id 

```


As we see, there is no case-related problems:  both t_order_0 and t_order_item_0 are in lowercase.

So, I want to know more info to reproduce the issue. 
Tks.

@terrymanu 

INSERT INTO t_account(account_id, certificate_number, password, amount, status) VALUES...
the order ins sql is certificate_number、password、amount
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8772975/67289292-f4fcc980-f510-11e9-88fd-f978a6e6ffb1.png)
the order in encryption rules is certificate_number、password、amount

**this case is ok!  
if the order ins sql is not 'certificate_number、password、amount' ， the order of this case is not ok!
We can not  guarantee that the order of columns in sql is consistent with the data in encryption rules.**

I get the network packet through `Wireshark` software, and find some problem. **When MySQL transfer data to Sharding-Proxy:** **When Sharding-Proxy transfer data to Navicat:** the two byte data `03 50` is missing, it is the table Primary Key flag. I think this make the mistake.

about this question,The query result should be plaintext. Now it is ciphertext. Is it normal?

![66756505-c2c5e900-eecc-11e9-9f24-8780f8e2dddd](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56537799/67374933-78232b80-f5b4-11e9-9e05-9c754859d14c.png)
![aHR0cHM6Ly9vc2NpbWcub3NjaGluYS5uZXQvb3NjbmV0LzM3NTczMThkZmJjM2M0OWY0N2UzOGZiMjA1YWZkZDRmOGQyLmpwZw](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56537799/67374942-7a858580-f5b4-11e9-8ceb-927d0bd4dcf4.png)

ShardingProxy decodes MySQL Query request package, and transform sql to String, which will be used to parse. 
But due to the charset, the Blob(binary) type can't transform to String. So some of special byte will be changed while the decode step.

I also add `useServerPrepStmts=true` and `cachePrepStmts=true` to jdbc url, but it will cause new exception: `Cause: java.sql.SQLException: 1Unsupported command: [COM_STMT_SEND_LONG_DATA]`

So, I think the problem need more investigation and discuss for the solutions.

Does any body have idea how mysql deal with the binary type protocol?

Hi,Have you ever run proxy bootstrap to test Nacos?not through test, and I find that it is null pointer.Because regCenter.getChildrenKeys(configNode.getSchemaPath()) is null.
